name: Yallands Farmhouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at Yallands for four nights and found it an oasis in the midst of modern housing. The service bus stops directly outside and it is very close to both the Park and Ride bus and the Somerset Heritage Centre. We were warmly welcomed and found both Karen and Chris very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Welcoming visit

reviews.text: We had a large comfortable room with a small en-suite. Everywhere was very clean. There is a very well equipped residents lounge.
reviews.title: Relaxing, Comfortable, Delicious, and Private

reviews.text: Breakfasts were varied and cooked to order. We thoroughly enjoyed the meal Karen prepared for us on the evening of our arrival and recommend you pre-order and sample her cooking.
reviews.title: Superb stay all round!

reviews.text: We shall certainly return here when next we visit the Heritage Centre or need to stay inTaunton.
reviews.title: our latest stay

reviews.text: When I traveled to Taunton I wanted to stay over at a English B&B to see what differences there are to the American B&Bs. I found that the need for privacy is ever present and the helpfulness of the owners is indeed impeccable.
reviews.title: Welcoming owners, perfect room, great location

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Yallands Farmhouse B & B in Taunton and have to say it's one of the best I've ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Perfect stay, lovely hosts - comfy bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was like a hidden gem. The pictures on the internet showed a lovely old farmhouse style building, I followed the sat nav onto a housing estate and truly thought it had sent me the wrong way, but I kept going and found the B & B tucked away in the corner of the estate.
reviews.title: Ron and Lesley England

reviews.text: The B & B was spotlessly clean but really comfortable and welcoming - furnished in a style that befitted it's era. It was so nice not to be in some generic hotel room - but in such a lovely house.
reviews.title: Very welcoming B&B

reviews.text: The gardens were also really very tidy, although it was too cold to go out and enjoy them, they were full of wild birds and I felt as though I was in the country rather than a large town.
reviews.title: Hospitality

reviews.text: The hosts were lovely, I arrived earlier than the proper check in time - but it was no problem, I received a very nice welcome. On being shown to my room it was exactly as shown on the internet and the biggest bonus of all was the bed - it was just so comfy!
reviews.title: My stay at Yallands

reviews.text: Excellent service from the warm welcome on arrival to our final breakfast and sad goodbyes.
reviews.title: More homely than anywhere else I have stayed

reviews.text: Offered drinks, normal teas and coffees and the bonus of a choice of alcoholic drinks as they are licensed
reviews.title: Like staying with a very well organised friend!

reviews.text: Could not find better hosts than Karen and Chris who advised us of their facilities, showed us to our well fitted and cosy rooms. Cosy nice not small. They also gave advice on facilities in town for eating and shopping.
reviews.title: A west country home

reviews.text: Never felt more comfy whilst staying away from home
reviews.title: More like coming home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hosts here are very warm and welcoming and bend over backwards to make you feel comfortable. I mistakenly booked the wrong date but they managed to switch things around, right at the last minute - excellent customer service!
reviews.title: Visit to Yellands

reviews.text: I was made very welcome, even got the log fire lit for me and it was nice to be able to sit in front of it with a couple of glasses of wine for the evening instead of being stuck in my room. Room was lovely, breakfast excellent, nice & quiet even though it is in a residential area. Would be an ideal base for looking around the area or, if like me, excellent for a night away on business.
reviews.title: Home from home, log fire included!

reviews.text: We booked two rooms at last minute as we were passing through Taunton. We were greeted with an extremely warm welcome. The rooms were so homely and very comfortable. Chris and Karen were superb. Very welcoming an eager for a chat downstairs in the lounge over a drink. Breakfast was delish. Head for the thai restaurant in Taunton for a little extra treat after your meal ;-) Thanks guys!
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was lucky enough to get treated to a surprise weekend away in Taunton by my girlfriend. What a wonderful choice of hotel she made.
reviews.title: They know how to get it right!
Very welcoming top class B&B
reviews.text: The Farmhouse is actually in a residential area but you wouldn't know it once you are inside.

reviews.title: A great independent B&B
reviews.text: Run by Chris and Karen they have a keen eye as to how things should be done. Excellent service and lovely traditional rooms. We actually got to try two of them as we added the second night later and the first room was not available for both nights. They were of a high standard and both rooms provided an excellent night's sleep.

description: Owners Chris & Karen Ward look forward to welcoming you to Yallands Farmhouse - our delightful Grade II Listed building dating back over 400 years, which sat amidst acres of green fields for several centuries. The expansion of Taunton during the 1970's led to new housing being built on the former farmland. The farmhouse, with its secluded garden, small orchard, and stone barn was left intact. As a result, Yallands has become an unexpected 'oasis' of peace and tranquility within a modern corner of Somerset's county town. Yallands offers Visit England 4 star accommodation in Taunton, Somerset. The house is situated 1½ miles from Taunton town centre, on the north-western edge of the town, and is easily reached from the M5 motorway - junction 25 (4 miles), and junction 26 (6 miles). For those who are reliant on public transport a local bus, with a stop at the foot of the garden, provides a frequent daytime service to and from the town centre. The lovely town centre provides excellent shopping and county cricket, horse racing, golf, theatre and other leisure facilities are all available nearby. Taunton has a good selection of restaurants and wine bars to suit most tastes and the surrounding countryside offers many delightful pubs which serve excellent food. There is ample car parking space in the private grounds together with lockable cycle storage in the stables. Why not enjoy relaxing in our gardens in the summer or sitting in front of our open fire in those cold winter months? Yallands is open all year round and - whether you are a tourist or a business visitor - you can be assured of a warm welcome and our individual attention.***We are now able to offer evening meals. Please see menu tab on the left of the screen - 24 hours' advance notice is usually required.***Yallands is particularly convenient for Taunton School, The Somerset Heritage Centre & Nuffield Hospital.
